arts.ttl: Marmoush to the fore as Frankfurt overcome Slavia Praha
arts.sum: A bitter autumnal night in the Hessen state provided the backdrop at the Deutsche-Bank Park for Eintracht Frankfurt to take on Slavia Prague, in which the hosts prevailed 1-0 thanks to a sublime Omar Marmoush freekick.

arts.ttl: Confirmed lineups: Eintracht Frankfurt vs. Slavia Praha
arts.sum: Official team news has just been released for Die Adler who welcome Czechia opposition Slavia Prague to the Deutsche-Bank Park for Matchday 4 of the UEFA Europa League.

arts.ttl: Alexander Nübel vs. Kevin Trapp: game-changing goalkeepers as VfB Stuttgart host Eintracht Frankfurt
arts.sum: Eintracht's man between the sticks now wears the captain's armband following the retirement of club favourite Sebastian Rode and, despite missing three top-tier games with a hamstring injury this season, has still managed to play an integral role in helping Frankfurt challenge among the top three spots in the Bundesliga this term. All eyes will turn to the MHPArena on Sunday for a showdown that pits hosts VfB Stuttgart against Eintracht Frankfurt, and leading the case for either teams' defence in Baden-Württemberg will be a couple of custodians who command immense respect: Alexander Nübel and Kevin Trapp.

arts.ttl: NFL in Germany: Bayern Munich's Allianz Arena and Eintracht Frankfurt's Deutsche Bank Park hosting American football
arts.sum: The NFL’s biggest stars have had to freshen up on their German skills with the nation now part of the fabric of American Football with regular-season games played at Bayern Munich's Allianz Arena and Eintracht Frankfurt's Deutsche Bank Park. Germany will host its fourth NFL regular season game in November, with the roadshow heading back to Munich .

arts.ttl: Eintracht Frankfurt interested in Hoffenheim’s Tom Bischof
arts.sum: Bild reports that Eintracht Frankfurt are interested in Hoffenheim’s highly-rated youth midfielder Tom Bischof as his contract expires in the summer. Bischof has become a regular for Hoffenheim this season featuring…

arts.ttl: Arsenal transfer news: Gunners ready '€40m offer' for Frankfurt sensation
arts.sum: However, even if Arsenal did move for a Swedish player, their offer of €40m would likely be rejected by Frankfurt who value him closer to €70-80m. "Sources with a close understanding of his situation have informed CaughtOffside that Arsenal are considering testing the waters with a €40million bid for the player in January.

arts.ttl: Frankfurt among reported suitors for Hoffenheim starlet with expiring contract
arts.sum: According to Bild, Eintracht Frankfurt are interested in signing Hoffenheim prospect Tom Bischof, who is out of contract this summer.

arts.ttl: Could Omar Marmoush succeed Harry Kane at Bayern Munich?
arts.sum: Harry Kane (31) has registered 81 goal contributions (61 goals and 20 assists) in 59 games for Bayern Munich since his move in 2023 but with a contract until 2027,…

arts.ttl: Omar Marmoush crowned Player of the Month
arts.sum: Having taken the prize in September, Omar Marmoush has also been named as the Mainova Player of the Month for October by the Eintracht community

arts.ttl: Preview: Eintracht Frankfurt vs. Slavia Prague - prediction, team news, lineups
arts.sum: Sports Mole previews Thursday's Europa League clash between Eintracht Frankfurt and Slavia Prague, including predictions, team news and possible lineups.
